message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.HC 

This paper focuses on using mobile technology to mitigate the impact of infectious disease epidemics. The strategies proposed involve measuring and modeling behavioral patterns of the affected population, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the delivery of personalized recommendations in real-time, which could be considered a form of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Additionally, the use of mobile technology for public health purposes could be categorized under cyber-physical systems (cs.CY) and systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper discusses the potential impact on the economic and social well-being of developing countries, which could be relevant to the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR) if there are concerns about privacy and data security.
